question:
Match the type of adaptation given in List I with their examples given in List II.

| List I (Type of adaptation) | List II (Examples) |
|---|---|
| 1. Biochemical adaptation | p. Desert lizards |
| 2. Behavioural adaptation | q. Deep sea fishes |
| 3. Physiological adaptation | r. Opuntia |
| 4. Morphological adaptation | s. Kangaroo rats |
explanation: Deep sea fishes show biochemical adaptations (1-q). Desert lizards show behavioural adaptations (basking) (2-p). Kangaroo rats show physiological adaptations (concentrating urine) (3-s). Opuntia shows morphological adaptations (spines) (4-r).
